pitchLine: My passions are — cloud architecture, devops, clean code, setting up teams, tramping and travelling.

projects.name: Product Development
projects.description: Kaboodle is a full digital workplace experience based on our years of building intranets on SharePoint and Office 365. After many successful intranet projects, we found our clients wanted similar features with great branding and excellent user experiences.
achievements: market research of emerging out-of-the-box intranets
product ideation and mocking
feasibility analysis and pricing analysis
high level solution design with focus on extensibility points for market differentiation
travel to Vietnam to interview potential off-shore development partners
off-shore development team recruitment
training and education of development team
established development best practices
established continuous integration and deployment pipelines
established modified Agile Scrum methodology
ownership of product backlogs and team management
pull request and code review participation
team member periodic reviews
branding and marketing strategy and planning
public website development and design oversight
creation of marketing and supporting documentation
establish and management of ongoing client support
management of feature and release cycle
product demonstration and business development

projects.name: Review and Recommendations
projects.description: Aquiba has an active radio integration program to deliver digital water meters with world beating metrology and excellent product durability which are compatible with Utility network infrastructure. The proposed future for Aquiba being at scale created a need to review their initial in-house implementation with a view to providing it with a degree of hardness and robustness to service existing customers while the commercial and digital strategy evolved into a fully integrated vertical offering in the utility industry.
achievements: tenancy, account, and subscription topology. Highlighting structural, operational, cost and security issues
review of existing ad-hoc vm infrastructure
network vulnerabilities with emphasis on DDoS exposure from UDP
review of DevOps: repositories, development practices, feature / release cycles, code security, developer task management, IaC and release pipelines
review of application and vm logging
review of logging differentiation: metrics, trace, dependency, exceptions, availability and requests
code review: SANS SWAT, CWE, code smell, refactoring and home-rolled cryptography

projects.name: Phase 1: Core Implementation
projects.description: The review and recommendations above resulted in a phased approach to transition to recommendations. The Phase 1 focused on core Azure setup and hardening.
achievements: topology: implemented management groups, subscription isolation, cost and billing control
security: implemented RBAC, MFA, PIM. Security Centre and its recommendations
implemented Azure Key Vault
vm's: hardened with JIT through PIM, added anti-malware, encrypted disks, added performance monitoring
implemented CI/CD via IaC for VM's
implemented scale sets
upgraded DDoS on VNet
DevOps: implemented full IaC via Pulumi, Blueprints and ARM. Centralised repositories on Azure DevOps. Implemented GitFlow Branching and Pull Requests
logging and monitoring: implemented AppInsights, Azure Monitor, VM and network logging via Azure Monitor

projects.name: Phase 2: Kubernetes, Istio, APIM
projects.description: Phase 2 was the transition to Kubernetes and a microservice architecture. It also included the creation of a developer portal for the Aquiba Utility customers to access Water Meter data and management.
achievements: created DEV,UAT and PROD VNets
created VNet Subnets for DataLake, PostgreSQL, Kubernetes, APIM, GateWays
applied NSG's
created Azure Kubernetes Cluster
deployed Istio
dockerised existing Node/Express app
exposed public UDP endpoint to Water Meters
implmented APIM and WAF for their Customer API
created Aquiba Developer Portal for Utility Customers

projects.name: Phase 3: Service Separation
projects.description: This phase separated the single NodeJS/Express app into two separate services. One for the IoT / UDP endpoint servicing the Smart Water Meters and the other the Utility customer API.
achievements: isolated and optimised UDP code
isolated and optimised API code
created CI/CD pipelines
deployed to Kubernetes

projects.name: Enterprise Integration Strategy and Principles
projects.description: Establishment of Comvita's Integration strategy and Enterprise development principles
achievements: educated business on benefits of moving from BBoM to Domain Driven
established principles: Event Driven, API First, Domain Centric, Decentralised, Encapsulated, Automated, Fail Safe, Secure, Observable, Self Healing, Documented and Clean Code
high level architecture design
educated Comvita IT Team
worked with stakeholders

projects.name: Integration Team Establishment
projects.description: Establishment of Comvita's Offshore Integration development team based in Vietnam
achievements: traveled and lived in Ho Chi Minh Vietnam
used Vietnamese contacts to recruit team
conducted technical and soft interviews
upskilled the development team in Azure and integration principles
established development best practices
established continuous integration and deployment pipelines
established modified Agile Scrum methodology
integrated ticketing and support systems into workflow
supported existing MuleSoft integrations

projects.name: DDD and Microservice Core [The Core]
projects.description: In addition to standard integration requirements Comvita also wanted to increase organisational agility by moving away from a BBoM approach to a DDD based Microservice core [The Core].  We used a canonical approach to create central core microservices which were only interfaced with via an API and messaging and eventing buses. The Core is a combination of Service Fabric Actor Model and stateless services in an Azure Kubernetes Cluster. Services are primarily .NetCore with any external state in CosmosDB.
achievements: education of the wider group on Domain Driven Design [DDD] and microservices
established project tools and practices for the team
conducted Event Storming and Whirlpool workshops
high level solution architecture
planning, budgeting, managing of projects
established CQRS pattern
established event driven patterns
established APIM and messaging patterns
created and scaled clusters
created IaC for The Core via Pulumi and ARM
created CI/CD pipelines with GitFlow branching model
participated in pull requests and code reviews

projects.name: Development and Release of Integrations with The Core
projects.description: An anti-corruption layer was created for each LOB system. Systems did not interact directly with each other but rather via the core on an event driven basis. This enabled a CQRS pattern with asynchronous eventual consistency between all systems with a unified central core. All new development and interaction was via the Core API doing away with point to point integration. Design, development and implementation of integrations with most of Comvita's core systems.
achievements: co-ordinated with major stakeholders of business domains
designed of anti-corruption layers
documented Enterprise Messaging Patterns for developers
developed anti-corruption layers for developers to follow
co-ordinated, documented and scheduled deployments with zero downtime
designed and implemented monitoring systems

subprojects.name: ERP Integrations
subprojects.description: Kingdee ERP used by Comvita China JV for warehouse operations and typical logistics, sales, customer and other ERP functions. QAD ERP is used for rest of world operations including local manufacturing and global accounting and financials.

subprojects.name: 3PL Integrations
subprojects.description: Comvita use MainFreight, DPD and SPSCommerce among others for their third party logistics. We developed inward and outward integrations in varying protocols.

subprojects.name: Loyalty Integration
subprojects.description: Comvita use XGate for their Asian based Customer Loyalty systems . We developed integration with Sales, CRM and ERP systems via The Core.

subprojects.name: POS Integrations
subprojects.description: Comvita physical stores are primarily in Asia and use CBR and TTRetail POS systems. We integrated these with global ERP, CRM, Reporting and Logistics systems via The Core.

subprojects.name: HR and H&S Integrations
subprojects.description: Comvita use BambooHR for most of its Human Resource functions. Health and Safety is streamlined with She Assure. These were integrated with The Core.

subprojects.name: Apiary Management Integration
subprojects.description: Managing hives and sites is a key function for Comvita. Comvita have a bespoke legacy Apiary Management System with limited integration options. We developed integration to legacy system via the databse.

subprojects.name: Quality Integration
subprojects.description: Comvita employ rigorous testing and quality procedures to deliver the highest quality honey products. We integrated the OnQ Laboratory system with The Core.

subprojects.name: CRM Integration
subprojects.description: B2B and B2C Customer relationships are managed in SalesForce. We integrated SalesForce with The Core.

subprojects.name: Commerce Integrations
subprojects.description: Comvita sell direct to market via a global Oracle ATG commerce platform. In addition they sell via online marketplaces and also aggregators. We did a number of different types of integrations with Oracle ATG, Amazon, TMall, JD.com, Koala and Commerce Tools with The Core

subprojects.name: Content Integrations
subprojects.description: Core media assets are stored and curated in WebDam. Marketing and web content is available from Contentful. We developed integration with these in a point to point fashion with LOB systems.

subprojects.name: Planning and Analytics Integration
subprojects.description: Comvita manage their manufacturing and supply side planning with Adaptive Insights. We integrated AI with The Core.

subprojects.name: Supplier Integration
subprojects.description: Comvita manage supplier payments with Esker. We integrated Esker with The Core.

subprojects.name: Manufacturing Integration
subprojects.description: Comvita manage moisture content, weight and formulation with various SCADA. We integrated the SCADA work orders with The Core.

subprojects.name: Other Minor Integrations
subprojects.description: Comvita use a variety of social and communication tools. We integrated these with The Core and LOB Systems.

projects.name: Web & Mobile Application
projects.description: VanMan are a Wellington based removalist company offering superior service and scheduling. We developed a Web Application and Mobile Application to streamline operations for adminstrative and field workers.
achievements: tenancy, account, and subscription topology. Highlighting structural, operational, cost and security issues
review of existing ad-hoc vm infrastructure
network vulnerabilities with emphasis on DDoS exposure from UDP
review of DevOps: repositories, development practices, feature / release cycles, code security, developer task management, IaC and release pipelines
review of application and vm logging
review of logging differentiation: metrics, trace, dependency, exceptions, availability and requests
code review: SANS SWAT, CWE, code smell, refactoring and home-rolled cryptography

volunteer.description: I conducted a series of lectures for BIONIC University. Main topics: HTML / CSS / jQuery / Handlebars / Ajax / Production experience / Best practices

travel.description: We are currently travelling the South Island of New Zealand as a family, doing some of the Great Walks and as much tramping, swimming and outdoor activities as we can.

countries.description: I conducted a series of lectures for BIONIC University. Main topics: HTML / CSS / jQuery / Handlebars / Ajax / Production experience / Best practices

travel.description: 2020 started off with travel from Croatia to Vietnam for work for 3 months. This was cut short due to COVID. We returned to the UK and had plans to head to Norway before COVID hit again. We then retreated to Australia to visit grandparents. We have now returned home to NZ.
